args:
Despairing at humanity's deeds, Midgardsormr
abandons Alberius. At the same time, Elysium
leads a force of dragons toward the battlefield
in an attempt to bring judgment upon the errant
humans and defeat the Other personally.
We managed to fall back. Let's cut through\nthe woods and return to the cathedral.
There must be a way. I promise we'll get\nthe cardinal back from the Other.
You would save the man when his lust for\npower and abandonment of all reason\ncreated this madness in the first place?
Soft, Midgardsormr. Though he failed,\nhe truly did seek to aid the people.
Do you excuse the man's folly\nbecause you are both human?
Or is it because you find the mantle of\nhero granted to you by one with authority\nto be eminently comfortable?

Don't be absurd. I will defeat the Other
and protect human and dragon alike.
And for that purpose, I will risk my life. 
That's all.
...You've certainly grown accustomed to\nsacrificing yourself, Alberius.
But ultimately, it is of no matter.\nIf your aim is to continue the path you\nare on now...
Then our time together ends here.
I can't believe Cardinal Lambert\nbecome a host for the Other...
This is most terrible indeed—and will\nlikely plunge the Church into great turmoil.
Factions taking the side of Dyrenell\nmay even begin to crop up.
What?! We can't have the church\nsplintering! We've followed and trusted you\nthis whole time, you know!
Indeed. Without the backing of the Church,\nit is entirely possible that the territorial\nlords will side with the Empire.
I beg you to be patient. I have dispatched\na messenger to make haste to the Curia;\nwe shall wait for the Pope's instructions.
Yes, please endure until then.\nAnd remember, we still have the hero\nAlberius on our side.

But without the Church's authority,
his reputation is naught but a candle
in the wind—one stiff breeze away
from being snuffed out entirely!
Nevertheless, if we believe and pray,\nthe Goddess will grant her protection.
Where is that blessing right now, though?\nHeavens forfend, what is to become of us?!
(My father was a crucial support for the\nalliance, and with his loss, it is shaken.)
(He carried upon his back the well-being\nof those under his authority, and mere\nprayer alone will not restore that.)
(I do not believe my father's way was just.\nAnd I want to do SOMETHING, but...)
But my words move no one.
Alberius! What are you doing here?
I wanted to talk about what's next,\nso I came looking for you.\nWere you...crying?
I was merely wondering if we are destined\nto fail on our current course.

All this time, I believed it was faith
which formed the alliance and drove
its members to take up arms as
one. But it seems I was wrong.
Without my father as a support,\nthe movement is poised to splinter.
At this rate, faith may well lose—not only\nto the Other, but to the authority my father\nspoke of.
But you still want to win that fight, right?
Of course I do! I believe a heart full of\nprayer can grant the strength to fight.
Well, then, that means it's not time to\ndespair just yet.
After all, neither of us has given up.\nRight?
Even if the Other is back and the alliance\nfalls apart, I will continue the fight.
So long as you and our soldiers need me,\nI will be here for all of you.
And you are right: This is precisely the\nmoment when we must hew to our\nconvictions and press on.
Exactly. Right now, we must focus on\ndefeating the Other above all... Hmm?
The ground is rumbling—and the birds\nappear to be much disturbed.
It's a horde of dragons—and they're\nheaded this way!
By Ilia, they're attacking people! But why?!

Humans—and in particular adherents of
Ilia who long ago were charged with
defeating the Other—have by their own
hands given him flesh once more.
This act has incurred the divine wrath\nof the Holywyrm.
The Holywyrm will seek to fell the Other\nso order might be preserved.
If any soldiers fail to honor the ancient\naccord, their lives shall also be forfeit.
We can't allow that! Mym, let's go to the\nForbidden Dominion and speak with\nElysium again!
Where are you, Elysium?! Show yourself!
What brings you to me, child of man?
Call off your attack! You must not take\nhuman lives along with the Other's!
I refuse your exhortation; defeating the\nOther was the charge of humans,\nand they have abandoned their duty.
Holywyrm, you are correct that my father\nrestored the Other when he was sworn\nto do the opposite, but—
This spectacle is the fruit born of an\norganization sworn to end the Other\nfailing to abide their authority.
In giving her people this critical role,\nIlia hoped to protect them from me.

Yet it is her own faithful who cast aside
their charge and restored the Other.
I long believed humans to be immature,
childish things, and now it is proven true.
Yet there remain countless people who\nHAVE kept to Ilia's teachings and struggle\neven now to bring down the Other.
We haven't abandoned our mission to see\nhim laid low! You mustn't lose faith!
Even for a child of man, Alberius,\nyou are a naive and resounding fool.
I named you hero that the people's faith\nmight be strengthened—nothing more.

Yes. Seven hundred years ago, I accepted
that the sacred sword would be entrusted
to one of the dragonblood in order to keep
your people's fighting spirit burning hot.
Yet the arrangement conceived by Ilia\nseems woefully ineffective in this era.
Your kind is no longer necessary.\nI will slay the Other myself and cull your\nbrethren who do war—starting now.
*pant* *pant* This isn't good...\nIt's a full-scale natural disaster!
Your attempt to treat with the Holywyrm\nhas ended in failure, then? Sadly,\nthis comes as little surprise to me.
It seems you are firm in your resolve.\nIn that case, your only course of action\nis to stop Elysium by force.
You mean for him to fight the Holywyrm\noutside the bounds of their trial?!
If that is what it takes to stop this,\nthen I will see it done.
I will halt the Other's invasion\nand Elysium's judgment alike!
I see I was right to align myself with you.\nOn my back now, if you would.
Wait here, Myriam. I'm going to fix this!
If you are ready, we must be off.
